title: Financial services firms are wary of the use of AI in their business, study finds
description: Eight in 10 financial services firms in Ireland are either limiting their use of artificial intelligence (AI) or watching the technology from the sidelines, according to research from the Compliance Institute.
content:
A survey of more than 150 senior compliance professionals found that 77pc of respondents said their organisation has only limited use of AI or is not actively deploying it yet.
The findings come amid growing warnings from global banks and regulators ... [2093 chars]

title: Tech firms are persuading retailers to put AI everywhere
description: Stores of all kinds are using artificial intelligence to sell everything from luxury handbags to hay for horses.
content:
Retail’s foray into the world of artificial intelligence has been a free-for-all.
It doesn’t matter if they’re selling US$35,000 (RM141,837) ostrich leather handbags or chicken feed for US$0.90 (RM3.65) per pound (453g). Companies are trying to figur... [6171 chars]

title: UK rolls out visa sweeteners ahead of Davos meet to pull in global talent
description: Britain is launching new initiatives to draw in skilled professionals and international businesses. Focus areas include artificial intelligence, life sciences, and clean energy. Visa fee reimbursements and fast-track sponsor licenses are among the incentives. Chancellor Rachel Reeves is presenting the UK as a stable investment hub at the World Economic Forum in Davos.
content:

title: Sydney and UTS law schools get free access to Harvey AI
description: Students at the prestigious departments will have access to the specialist legal artificial intelligence platform in the hope students don’t get left behind.
content: Two top Sydney law schools will give their students full access to specialist legal artificial intelligence platform Harvey this year and increasingly use it in their teaching as part of a push to avoid a future where lawyers are slaves to a technolo... [275 chars]

title: Atomesus AI Surpasses 100,000 Active Users Within a Week, Signals New Era for Indigenous Indian Artificial Intelligence

title: Voice-Enabled, Multilingual AI Vital For Inclusive Healthcare In India: Officials
description: For artificial intelligence (AI) to deliver meaningful public value in a linguistically diverse country like India, it must be multilingual and voice-enabled according to Amitabh Nag, CEO, Digital India BHASHINI Division (DIBD).
content:

title: Inside China's buzzing AI scene year after DeepSeek shock
description: Before DeepSeek shook up the tech world and put Chinese artificial intelligence on the map, Wu Chenglin's own startup had nearly folded three times – but in the past year it has raised US$30mil (RM121.57mil).
content:

title: China Electric Stocks Jump on Booming AI Demand, Investment Push
description: Chinese electric stocks are winning favor with investors early in 2026, thanks to intensifying global demand for power gear to build data centers for artificial intelligence as well as a state-led investment push in the sector.
content:

title: Artificial Intelligence: Revolutionizing Every Aspect of Life - AI democratizing intelligence in food delivery business: Swiggy executive
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly redefining the way we live, work, and interact. No longer confined to the realm of science fiction, AI is now a driving force behind innovations across all sectors— from healthcare and finance to entertainment and manufacturing. Its impact is far-reaching, transforming industries, reshaping economies, and influencing the way we navigate daily life.
